content.description:
Aside from the cons associated with literally climbing out of the ditch to start the route, this is a fun easy route close to Hope with zero approach. Once you're a pitch or two off the deck, you'll lose sight of the highway and only have the river below you. The first pitch is the mellow crux and is usually the fattest. 35m. Next climb another 35m consisting of two WI2ish steps. Then take your pick of either of two rambly WI2-3 pitches. The left parallels an overhanging granite cliff and stays free of snow. You can run these for almost 60m if you want. Both continue up into the forest via easy rambling with possible steeper steps, generally petering out after another 70m or less. Descend the route on threads. Two 60s make this easiest, but a single 70 will still get you down with an extra v-thread or two. Descending through the trees climbers right (above the Ridder and Mr. Freeze) may be possible. The route is immediately on your left after driving through the Sailor Bar tunnel (signed) if coming from Hope. Park in the pullout to the right, directly across from the route. Hard to miss.

If it's snowing and plows are running, there's a larger pullout on the left another 500m north. screws. shorter screws often work a little better in the sometimes finicky west coast ice.

Highway 1 between Hope and Lytton winds through the beautiful Fraser River Canyon. A lot of rock and a lot of ice make this an easy drive to get distracted on as a climber. Much of the ice on the east side of the river is relatively unexplored but looks spectacular.
